item.title: Beogram 4000: An Unusual Keypad PCB
item.description:
This article highlights a unique Beogram 4000 keyboard PCB. Typically, the two bulbs illuminating the position scale are wired in series, using two 12V bulbs connected between the 24V power source and ground. This setup is illustrated in the first image and diagram. Notably, this series configuration results in the bulbs having opposite polarity. This polarity difference is ideal for the author’s polarized LED replacement boards. The second image showcases these boards...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4000-an-unusual-keypad-pcb/
